page.title: 11Working days (cont)
page.content: A typical day at Baldoukie Farm My Dad gets up at 5:00 a.m. to do the milking.First he herds the cows into the dairy and milks them.Then I have to herd the cows back into the field while Dad cleans up the dairy with a power hose.The next job is to feed the calves.I have to hold the bottles of milk while the calves are drinking and I also give them cattle-cake to eat. Then Dad lets me drive the tractor up the ramp and into the passage while my brother William shovels the draft out of the tractor. Draft is feed for the cows.After breakfast William and I have to feed the bullocks in the high field.I drive the tractor and William forks the straw and turnips out of the trailer for the animals to eat.When time allows between farmwork and housework Mum and Dad look after the garden
